# Unicode Properties Module Documentation

This Python module contains Unicode character property definitions for version 13.0.0. It provides comprehensive mappings of Unicode characters organized by their properties and categories.

## Purpose

This module serves as a reference for Unicode character classification, enabling applications to:
- Identify character types (letters, numbers, punctuation, etc.)
- Validate character properties
- Implement Unicode-aware text processing
- Support internationalization features

## Structure

The module contains two main data structures:

### `unicode_properties`
A comprehensive dictionary containing full Unicode property mappings for Unicode 13.0.0.

### `ascii_properties`
A simplified dictionary containing ASCII-only character property mappings for basic Latin characters.

## Property Categories

Both dictionaries use the following top-level keys representing Unicode general categories:

### `"c"` - Other Characters
- **`"^"`**: All characters except control characters
- **`"^c"`**: All characters except control characters (alternative)
- **`"^f"`**: All characters except format characters
- **`"^n"`**: All characters except unassigned characters
- **`"^o"`**: All characters except private use characters
- **`"^s"`**: All characters except surrogate characters
- **`"c"`**: Control characters (C0 and C1 controls)
- **`"f"`**: Format characters
- **`"n"`**: Unassigned code points
- **`"o"`**: Private use characters
- **`"s"`**: Surrogate code points

### `"l"` - Letters
- **`"^"`**: All non-letter characters
- **`"^c"`**: All characters except cased letters
- **`"^l"`**: All characters except lowercase letters
- **`"^m"`**: All characters except modifier letters
- **`"^o"`**: All characters except other letters
- **`"^t"`**: All characters except titlecase letters
- **`"^u"`**: All characters except uppercase letters
- **`"c"`**: Cased letters (uppercase, lowercase, titlecase)
- **`"l"`**: Lowercase letters
- **`"m"`**: Modifier letters
- **`"o"`**: Other letters
- **`"t"`**: Titlecase letters
- **`"u"`**: Uppercase letters

### `"m"` - Marks
- **`"^"`**: All non-mark characters
- **`"^c"`**: All characters except combining marks
- **`"^e"`**: All characters except enclosing marks
- **`"^n"`**: All characters except non-spacing marks
- **`"c"`**: Combining marks
- **`"e"`**: Enclosing marks
- **`"n"`**: Non-spacing marks

### `"n"` - Numbers
- **`"^"`**: All non-numeric characters
- **`"^d"`**: All characters except decimal digits
- **`"^l"`**: All characters except letter numbers
- **`"^o"`**: All characters except other numbers
- **`"d"`**: Decimal digit characters
- **`"l"`**: Letter numbers
- **`"o"`**: Other numbers (fractions, superscripts, etc.)

### `"p"` - Punctuation
- **`"^"`**: All non-punctuation characters
- **`"^c"`**: All characters except connector punctuation
- **`"^d"`**: All characters except dash punctuation
- **`"^e"`**: All characters except close punctuation
- **`"^f"`**: All characters except final punctuation
- **`"^i"`**: All characters except initial punctuation
- **`"^o"`**: All characters except other punctuation
- **`"^s"`**: All characters except open punctuation
- **`"c"`**: Connector punctuation (underscores, etc.)
- **`"d"`**: Dash punctuation
- **`"e"`**: Close punctuation (closing brackets, etc.)
- **`"f"`**: Final punctuation (closing quotes, etc.)
- **`"i"`**: Initial punctuation (opening quotes, etc.)
- **`"o"`**: Other punctuation
- **`"s"`**: Open punctuation (opening brackets, etc.)

### `"s"` - Symbols
- **`"^"`**: All non-symbol characters
- **`"^c"`**: All characters except currency symbols
- **`"^k"`**: All characters except modifier symbols
- **`"^m"`**: All characters except math symbols
- **`"^o"`**: All characters except other symbols
- **`"c"`**: Currency symbols
- **`"k"`**: Modifier symbols
- **`"m"`**: Math symbols
- **`"o"`**: Other symbols

### `"z"` - Separators
- **`"^"`**: All non-separator characters
- **`"^l"`**: All characters except line separators
- **`"^p"`**: All characters except paragraph separators
- **`"^s"`**: All characters except space separators
- **`"l"`**: Line separator characters
- **`"p"`**: Paragraph separator characters
- **`"s"`**: Space separator characters

## Data Format

Each property maps to a string containing Unicode character ranges in a compressed format:
- Single characters: `"A"`
- Character ranges: `"A-Z"`
- Multiple ranges: `"A-Za-z0-9"`
- Unicode escapes: `"\u0000-\u001f"`

## Usage Examples

```python
# Check if a character is a decimal digit
def is_decimal_digit(char):
    return char in unicode_properties["n"]["d"]

# Check if a character is uppercase
def is_uppercase(char):
    return char in unicode_properties["l"]["u"]

# Get all punctuation characters
punctuation_chars = unicode_properties["p"]["o"]
```

## Notes and Suggestions

### Performance Considerations
- The character range strings are optimized for space but may require parsing for direct character lookup
- Consider converting to sets or other data structures for frequent lookups
- ASCII properties provide faster lookups for basic Latin text

### Unicode Version
- This data is specifically for Unicode 13.0.0
- Newer Unicode versions may have additional characters or property changes
- Consider updating the data when supporting newer Unicode standards

### Memory Usage
- The full Unicode properties dictionary is quite large
- Use ASCII properties when only basic Latin character support is needed
- Consider lazy loading or subsetting for
